intro: Pluchea incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or whitish, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Pluchea incisa is often found in moist, open habitats such as forests, wetlands, and disturbed areas.
